Slise#

class spy4cast.Slise(lat0: Union[float, int], latf: Union[float, int], lon0: Union[float, int], lonf: Union[float, int], month0: Union[spy4cast.stypes.Month, int], monthf: Union[spy4cast.stypes.Month, int], year0: int, yearf: int, sy: Optional[int] = None)#

Bases: object

Dataclass to create a Slise

A slise is the way of slicing datasets that is convenient to the user and the API

Note

The developers of this API are aware that the correct slpelling for slice is with a c. However, slice is a built-in function in python and in the start of the development of this poject was better to use slise. This is the reason why this class is spelled with s (it wouldn’t conflict with slice right now because it is capitalised, but it looks good enough, right?)

Attributes Summary

lat0

Minimum latitude

latf

Maximum latitude

lon0

Minimum longitud

lonf

Maximum longitud

month0

Starting month of the season to select (included)

monthf

Ending month of the season to select (included)

sy

Selected year used in methodologies like anom where you can only plot a given year

year0

Starting year of the period to select (included)

yearf

Ending year of the period to select (included)

Methods Summary

default([month0, monthf, year0, yearf, sy])

Alternartive constructor that creates a Slise that has the largest spatial region and season possible

Methods Documentation

classmethod default(month0: int = Month.JAN, monthf: int = Month.DEC, year0: int = 0, yearf: int = 2000, sy: Optional[int] = None) → spy4cast.stypes.Slise#

Alternartive constructor that creates a Slise that has the largest spatial region and season possible

It is useful if you want to create fast a Slise where you conly want to modify the initial and final year for example

Return type

Slise(-90, 90, -180, 180, month0, monthf, year0, yearf, sy)
